meanings.definition: Woonerfs: a type of street or neighborhood designed to prioritize pedestrians over vehicles
meanings.sent1: The woonerfs in our town have benches and trees for people to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: I love walking through the woonerfs in the city; it feels so peaceful.
meanings.sent3: The woonerfs were so inviting that even the dogs wanted to take a stroll.
meanings.sent4: The woonerfs were like havens amidst the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent5: The woonerfs were like little oases of calm in the urban jungle.

meanings.definition: Woonerfs: to transform a street or neighborhood into a pedestrian-friendly area
meanings.sent1: We need to woonerfs this busy street to make it safer for pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to woonerfs the old town square for the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent3: The mayor woonerfsed the main road, much to the surprise of the residents.
meanings.sent4: The community effort to woonerfs the neighborhood was a great success.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers worked tirelessly to woonerfs the park for the children to play safely.

meanings.definition: Woonerfs: the plural form of woonerf, referring to multiple pedestrian-friendly areas.
meanings.sent1: The woonerfs in Europe are known for their beautiful architecture and green spaces.
meanings.sent2: She visited several woonerfs during her trip and was impressed by the urban planning.
meanings.sent3: The woonerfs in the city formed a network of safe pathways for pedestrians.
meanings.sent4: The woonerfs connected different parts of the neighborhood, creating a sense of community.
meanings.sent5: The woonerfs were like interconnected islands of tranquility in the bustling city.
